column1:
Localization files are formatted like CSV so they can be easily edited,
however formatting has strict rules for easy parsing. Most of these rules
are already handled by Excel / Libre / etc., so you don't have to worry
about them in normal usage. However, if your localization file seems to
be corrupted, these rules may be helpful for debugging purposes...
- In general, any consecutive string of \r and \n (in any order) will be
  treated as one SINGLE line break, except within an enclosed context
- The first 4 rows can be arbitrarily long
  - The first cell of first row is used to store this block of instruction
    text
  - The first 3 cells of the fourth row is used as headers
  - All other cells in the first and fourth rows are ignored
  - Columns in the second row alternate between property and value (ex.
    ' foo | 1 | bar | 3.5 | ... '
    - Any whitespaces before and after the property name are ignored
  - Columns in the third row are exclusively comments for properties in the
    second row
- Every following line can include any number of cells, but only the
  first three will be parsed (you can use the rest as comments if needed)
- The file must end in a sequence of \r and \n's
- Every cell containing a ^, \r, or \n must be enclosed in "
  - If a " is encountered right after a non-enclosed separator, \r, or \n,
    then the parser is said to enter an "enclosed context", such context
    ends immediately when a non-escaped " that is not followed by \r, \n,
    or a separator is encountered
  - " within each cell should be escaped using another " in front of it,
  - If a " is encountered in a non-enclosed context, and it is not right
    after a separator, \r, or \n, then it is entirely ignored
  - If a non-escaped " is encountered in an enclosed context...
    - If it is followed by a separator, \r, or \n, then it is considered
      the closing quote of the current context
    - Otherwise, it is ignored
  - If a separator, \r, or \n is encountered while in an enclosed context,
    it will be preserved

column3: NonDialogueFontScale

column1: Set to 1 allow the parser to read this file, otherwise it will be skipped and the default English localization will be used as fallback
column3: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size.
column5: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size. Recommended setting is around 0.3~0.6.

column1: OceanShopCanvas/ShopPanel/Collectible Acquired Effect/Background Mask/Item Acquired Text
column2: Item Acquired!
column3: _yar_Item Acquired!_yar_

column2: I don't like to gossip, but... that Romeo REALLY wants to get with Juliet. It's really been weighing him down. If you can be a solid wingman, maybe he can get his message across.
column3: _arrr_I don't like to gossip, but... that Romeo REALLY wants to get with Juliet. It's really been weighing him down. If you can be a solid wingman, maybe he can get his message across._arrr_

column2: Beware of disturbing the seas though. Too much water can sink even the most heartfelt messages.
column3: _yar_Beware of disturbing the seas though. Too much water can sink even the most heartfelt messages._yar_

column2: Some shifty-looking fellows walked in a while ago. They pay well so I can't complain, but something seems different about them.
column3: _yar_Some shifty-looking fellows walked in a while ago. They pay well so I can't complain, but something seems different about them._yar_

column2: They looked in an awful hurry, carrying something with them too.
column3: _yar_They looked in an awful hurry, carrying something with them too._yar_

column2: The Tavern Pass we're trying out is pretty neat, huh?
column3: _ho_The Tavern Pass we're trying out is pretty neat, huh?_ho_

column2: Don't ask too much about the rewards. Oh, but for the final reward, I'll do anything you want!
column3: _arrr_Don't ask too much about the rewards. Oh, but for the final reward, I'll do anything you want!_arrr_

column2: Looks like under your name we have registered that you want to go to the Jungle up north.
column3: _yar_Looks like under your name we have registered that you want to go to the Jungle up north._yar_

column2: Anyways, I can definitely help you on your way to Canopy Town if you finish our Tavern Pass.
column3: _yar_Anyways, I can definitely help you on your way to Canopy Town if you finish our Tavern Pass._yar_

column2: Remember: If you ever run into trouble, Bob's is the one-stop-shop for all the seafaring advice you'll ever need!
column3: _yar_Remember: If you ever run into trouble, Bob's is the one-stop-shop for all the seafaring advice you'll ever need!_yar_

column2: Remember: If you ever run into trouble, Bob's is the one-stop-shop for all the seafaring advice you'll ever need!
column3: _ho_Remember: If you ever run into trouble, Bob's is the one-stop-shop for all the seafaring advice you'll ever need!_ho_

column2: A treetop town in the jungle to the North. Used to be nice and quiet, perfect for a picnic.
column3: _ho_A treetop town in the jungle to the North. Used to be nice and quiet, perfect for a picnic._ho_

column2: Some blowhard named Barron hurried into the place and started up all sorts of business and noise.
column3: _yar_Some blowhard named Barron hurried into the place and started up all sorts of business and noise._yar_

column2: Welcome back sailor!
column3: _arrr_Welcome back sailor!_arrr_

column2: Find anything interesting today?
column3: _ho_Find anything interesting today?_ho_

column2: Looks like a good day to set sail!
column3: _ho_Looks like a good day to set sail!_ho_

column2: Buccaneer Bob, at your service.
column3: _arrr_Buccaneer Bob, at your service._arrr_

column2: What can I do for you today?
column3: _arrr_What can I do for you today?_arrr_

column2: Ahoy there!
column3: _arrr_Ahoy there!_arrr_

column2: Legends say the volcano only erupts when the rocks align, at least according to the old heads.
column3: _arrr_Legends say the volcano only erupts when the rocks align, at least according to the old heads._arrr_

column2: Well, we've got a new business model- Oh, what's that? Your cat, <var>Cat</var>? I wager that's what the boys saw floating eastward!
column3: _arrr_Well, we've got a new business model- Oh, what's that? Your cat, <var>Cat</var>? I wager that's what the boys saw floating eastward!_arrr_

column2: You'd better keep yourself safe - military was deployed there. Even blocked off access from the Shifting Seas. If you really want to go, I reckon you ought to go around the long way, through Canopy Town and the Factory.
column3: _arrr_You'd better keep yourself safe - military was deployed there. Even blocked off access from the Shifting Seas. If you really want to go, I reckon you ought to go around the long way, through Canopy Town and the Factory._arrr_

column2: But don't worry, I've got something perfect for you! Look pal, we're trying a new, "Business" model. Remember that tavern pass I mentioned?
column3: _arrr_But don't worry, I've got something perfect for you! Look pal, we're trying a new, "Business" model. Remember that tavern pass I mentioned?_arrr_

column2: How it works is, YOU bring me treasures from around the sea, and I'LL give you some points. Get enough points and you'll get a reward! For the last reward, I can even help you reach your cat.
column3: _ho_How it works is, YOU bring me treasures from around the sea, and I'LL give you some points. Get enough points and you'll get a reward! For the last reward, I can even help you reach your cat._ho_

column2: I'm calling it, "Bob's Tavern Pass"! As my first subscriber, you get the first tier for free.
column3: _ho_I'm calling it, "Bob's Tavern Pass"! As my first subscriber, you get the first tier for free._ho_

column2: If you fix my island with that tablet of yours, I can help you cross over to Canopy Town.
column3: _yar_If you fix my island with that tablet of yours, I can help you cross over to Canopy Town._yar_

column2: I'll bust out the old axe and cut the trees above the tavern.
column3: _arrr_I'll bust out the old axe and cut the trees above the tavern._arrr_

column2: Ahoy matey! Welcome to Buccaneer Bob's. Here in the Shifting Seas, freedom is our creed. Just don't get lost -- the oceans are filled with treasure.
column3: _yar_Ahoy matey! Welcome to Buccaneer Bob's. Here in the Shifting Seas, freedom is our creed. Just don't get lost -- the oceans are filled with treasure._yar_

column2: Now what are we looking for? Drinks, perhaps? Or are you interested in my all-new Tavern Pass?
column3: _yar_Now what are we looking for? Drinks, perhaps? Or are you interested in my all-new Tavern Pass?_yar_

column2: What's that? You've already got an <#2e44f0>anchor</color>?! We've got a legend in the making, no doubt!
column3: _ho_What's that? You've already got an <#2e44f0>anchor</color>?! We've got a legend in the making, no doubt!_ho_

column2: Some funky fellow, Fezziwig, been messing around with some magicks. This whole world's gone a bit crazy recently, hasn't it?
column3: _yar_Some funky fellow, Fezziwig, been messing around with some magicks. This whole world's gone a bit crazy recently, hasn't it?_yar_

column2: Don't tell anyone, but I love slipping mushrooms into some of my drinks. Think of it as a secret ingredient of sorts.
column3: _ho_Don't tell anyone, but I love slipping mushrooms into some of my drinks. Think of it as a secret ingredient of sorts._ho_

column2: Hold on now, it seems you've got no coin in those pockets!
column3: _arrr_Hold on now, it seems you've got no coin in those pockets!_arrr_

column2: And you don't have an <#2e44f0>anchor</color>? Every self-respecting pirate has an anchor!
column3: _ho_And you don't have an <#2e44f0>anchor</color>? Every self-respecting pirate has an anchor!_ho_

column2: Quickly now, go find one. I don't want people seein' an anchorless schmuck in my tavern. Bring one back and I'll see what I can do for you.
column3: _arrr_Quickly now, go find one. I don't want people seein' an anchorless schmuck in my tavern. Bring one back and I'll see what I can do for you._arrr_

column2: Wish you could stay, but something tells me you have places to be.
column3: _yar_Wish you could stay, but something tells me you have places to be._yar_

column2: Safe travels! And welcome to the Jungle.
column3: _yar_Safe travels! And welcome to the Jungle._yar_

column2: Bring me back a souvenir.
column3: _ho_Bring me back a souvenir._ho_

column2: > You watch as he leaves, with haste and his sharp axe.
column3: _ho_> You watch as he leaves, with haste and his sharp axe._ho_

column2: > He takes large strides, his massive figure easily pushing the tavern doors open.
column3: _ho_> He takes large strides, his massive figure easily pushing the tavern doors open._ho_

column2: > You sneak a peak through the window.
column3: _ho_> You sneak a peak through the window._ho_

column2: *CHOP, CHOP, CHOP*
column3: _yar_*CHOP, CHOP, CHOP*_yar_

column2: > He cuts them down... so easily.
column3: _ho_> He cuts them down... so easily._ho_

column2: > Of course, he'd wipe some sweat from his brow. But this was of no effort to a man like Bob.
column3: _ho_> Of course, he'd wipe some sweat from his brow. But this was of no effort to a man like Bob._ho_

column2: > He doesn't notice you watching through the window as he makes his way back in.
column3: _arrr_> He doesn't notice you watching through the window as he makes his way back in._arrr_

column2: > Axe on shoulder, he pushes the doors open and hops over the bar counter.
column3: _arrr_> Axe on shoulder, he pushes the doors open and hops over the bar counter._arrr_

column2: Heard the Black Trident broke upon some rocks earlier today. Poor Catbeard. Might be worth searching the area.
column3: _yar_Heard the Black Trident broke upon some rocks earlier today. Poor Catbeard. Might be worth searching the area._yar_

column2: You want to know how to get up amongst the stars?
column3: _yar_You want to know how to get up amongst the stars?_yar_

column2: Well, the folks at the Magic Research Institute have been working on a rocket, so it might be your lucky day. Here, I'll show you on your map.
column3: _arrr_Well, the folks at the Magic Research Institute have been working on a rocket, so it might be your lucky day. Here, I'll show you on your map._arrr_

column2: Well... to be honest, never expected you to finish my battle pass. You really wanna find <var>Cat</var>?, eh?
column3: _yar_Well... to be honest, never expected you to finish my battle pass. You really wanna find <var>Cat</var>?, eh?_yar_

column2: Now that you've about explored the whole damn ocean, I reckon it's about time to put things in their rightful places.
column3: _arrr_Now that you've about explored the whole damn ocean, I reckon it's about time to put things in their rightful places._arrr_

column2: If you fix my island with that tablet of yours, I can help you cross over to Canopy Town. Only need the tavern part and the two beaches.
column3: _yar_If you fix my island with that tablet of yours, I can help you cross over to Canopy Town. Only need the tavern part and the two beaches._yar_

column2: I'll bust out the old axe and cut the trees north of the tavern.
column3: _yar_I'll bust out the old axe and cut the trees north of the tavern._yar_

column2: My hometown! A quaint little village to the West.
column3: _ho_My hometown! A quaint little village to the West._ho_

column2: Always used to play in this hidden cave behind the waterfall, made a lot of memories there. I should go back and visit sometime soon.
column3: _arrr_Always used to play in this hidden cave behind the waterfall, made a lot of memories there. I should go back and visit sometime soon._arrr_

column2: An old ship helmed by the good Captain Mako, anchored to the South. Used to run with his crew before I opened the tavern.
column3: _arrr_An old ship helmed by the good Captain Mako, anchored to the South. Used to run with his crew before I opened the tavern._arrr_

column2: I don't mean to be rude but... he's a bit washed up now.
column3: _ho_I don't mean to be rude but... he's a bit washed up now._ho_

column2: Pierre the fisherman has his buoys in a mess. Can't say this is the first time either.
column3: _ho_Pierre the fisherman has his buoys in a mess. Can't say this is the first time either._ho_

column2: The plains to the east, now a hot-zone full of our nation's military.
column3: _yar_The plains to the east, now a hot-zone full of our nation's military._yar_

column2: I'm not sure what's happening, but word is it has to do with The Cataclysm.
column3: _yar_I'm not sure what's happening, but word is it has to do with The Cataclysm._yar_

column2: If your cat really is there, then you'll have to go the long way around. Head north to Canopy Town, then east to the Factory. Then you should have access the military zone.
column3: _arrr_If your cat really is there, then you'll have to go the long way around. Head north to Canopy Town, then east to the Factory. Then you should have access the military zone._arrr_

column2: Big, ancient crater that formed a desert to the north.
column3: _arrr_Big, ancient crater that formed a desert to the north._arrr_

column2: Some tell tall tales of strange happenings, things that can't be explained. I don't believe a word of it.
column3: _ho_Some tell tall tales of strange happenings, things that can't be explained. I don't believe a word of it._ho_

column2: Business has taken a hit recently, with The Cataclysm and all that, but we're still afloat. Talk to some of the customers here, you might learn something!
column3: _arrr_Business has taken a hit recently, with The Cataclysm and all that, but we're still afloat. Talk to some of the customers here, you might learn something!_arrr_

column2: There's a treacherous patch of foggy sea down south we call "The Veil". Who knows what the mist may be hiding.
column3: _ho_There's a treacherous patch of foggy sea down south we call "The Veil". Who knows what the mist may be hiding._ho_

column2: Tales tell of a song of THREE pairs of verses needed to navigate it. Think it started with "West, South,", but I forgot the rest.
column3: _arrr_Tales tell of a song of THREE pairs of verses needed to navigate it. Think it started with "West, South,", but I forgot the rest._arrr_

column2: Maybe others know the rest of the song? Or it might be written down, eroded away in sand.
column3: _ho_Maybe others know the rest of the song? Or it might be written down, eroded away in sand._ho_

column2: Aye, that's a solid tool there. In fact, that was awfully quick. Keep it up, and you might just make a name for yourself around here.
column3: _arrr_Aye, that's a solid tool there. In fact, that was awfully quick. Keep it up, and you might just make a name for yourself around here._arrr_

column2: Catch of the day, eh? They say a golden fish brings good tidings.
column3: _arrr_Catch of the day, eh? They say a golden fish brings good tidings._arrr_

column2: A magical gem! Heard them hard-hat types are mining for these babies in the mountains.
column3: _yar_A magical gem! Heard them hard-hat types are mining for these babies in the mountains._yar_

column2: A fine haul! You'd make a smashing pirate.
column3: _ho_A fine haul! You'd make a smashing pirate._ho_

column2: Never seen anything like this before. Maybe I should try it in a new cocktail...
column3: _arrr_Never seen anything like this before. Maybe I should try it in a new cocktail..._arrr_

column2: Is this what I think it is? How'd you even get this? You, my friend, are something special.
column3: _arrr_Is this what I think it is? How'd you even get this? You, my friend, are something special._arrr_

column2: You one of those hopeless romantic types? I appreciate the sentiment.
column3: _yar_You one of those hopeless romantic types? I appreciate the sentiment._yar_

column2: A treasure chest? The One Piece is Real!
column3: _arrr_A treasure chest? The One Piece is Real!_arrr_

column2: Visiting are you? Enjoy your stay!
column3: _ho_Visiting are you? Enjoy your stay!_ho_

column2: Grew up in Stonybrook Village, lived the quiet life but I always wanted more. Joined a pirate crew young, eventually retired and took up business here.
column3: _arrr_Grew up in Stonybrook Village, lived the quiet life but I always wanted more. Joined a pirate crew young, eventually retired and took up business here._arrr_

column2: I wanted to stay close to the sea and my people. Can't say I'm not lucky to have lived the life I have.
column3: _yar_I wanted to stay close to the sea and my people. Can't say I'm not lucky to have lived the life I have._yar_
